About

I am currently pursuing my PhD in Neuroscience at Poietis Ltd under the Marie Curie Fellowship Program, ASCTN. I am passionate about using biology and harnessing technology to implement solutions in the field of healthcare. Broadly, I am interested in science, technology, and equality and how these aspects together impact the real world. A look at my timeline discusses my academic trajectory over the past few years. I am also the COO of My Story As A (Wo)man, an NGO that address trauma faced by womxn in India. If not discussing science or feminism, you can find me cooking spicy food, watercolour painting and delving into netflix releases. “Deepshika” in Sanskrit translates to “the light of a flame from a lamp”, it signifies the presence of light as knowledge and truly, I get the greatest joy in pursuing knowledge, analyzing and discussing it.

PROJECTS

Assessing synaptic phenotype of STXBP1 syndrome in isogenic iPSC-derived neurons

Advisors: Dr. Ruud Toonen January 2020 - August 2020, VU Amsterdam 1. Patch Clamp Electrophysiology on STXBP1(+/+) and STXBP1(-/-) iPSC-derived NGN2 neruons
2. Investigated using imuunostaining, protein quantication and confocal microscopy


Effect of rapamycin treatment on the expression levels of EFEMP1 and MMP13 mRNA in iPSC-derived Tuberous Sclerosis Complex astrocytes

September 2019 Project


Establishing RNAscope ISH and detection of Lin41 and FoxJ1 mRNA in mouse development

Advisors: Dr. Gregory Wulczyn July 2019 - August 2019 1. Established RNAscope method and optimized the work flow
2. Analyzed Lin41 and FoxJ1 mRNA presence in mouse tissue at E9.5, E14, P1, P28
3. Implemented imageJ macros and streamlined data analysis


Effect of KCC2 modulation on the excitability of rat and human neocortex tissue using Multi Electrode Arrays

Advisors: Dr. Ulf Strauss February 2019 - March 2019 1. Set up MEA equipment in the lab
2. Tested the action of VU0463271 and CLP257 on neocortical slices
3.Optimized recording times, characterized ictal-like events and inter-ictal discharges in MEA recordings


Premalignant Pancreatic Cancer Detection Using Mass-Spectrometry Data By Computational Methods

Advisors: Dr. Satish Babu January 2018 - May 2018 1. Compared classification of data using KNN, NNA, DTA and SVM methods


Presynaptic targeting of the ligand in TRACT systems

Khorana Scholarship

Advisors: Dr. Carlos Lois May 2017 - August 2019, California Institute of Technology 1. Tested three presynaptic markers and calculated their efficiencies in the targetting
2. Performed confocal microscopy and assisted in molecular biology validation
3. Parallel Project: Functional dynamics of brain restoration in Zebra Finches
